Beautiful home that is well kept. TV had all of the streaming channels. We enjoyed our stay and will be back if we visit the area again.
If you are from the flat hot south a few things to note. The house sits on a high sloping hill. The driveway has a sharp decline so you will need to set your parking brake (something we don't use very often in TX). The house has a furnace but no central air and no window units. We opened the window and turned on the ceiling fans. It was fine because the nighttime temperatures were low in late May.
Again, we highly recommend this place if you are visiting the area.

You will be pleasantly surprised from the nice furnishings to the available coffee Kcups and many, many more appointed items that you need. Clean, comfortable and very accommodating. Loved having nice fans available too.
If you need anything or notice anything that needs to be addressed Roger will take care of it with a thankful attitude for being informed. As a family who has allergies to deal with it is nice to be able to stay in pet free zone.
Somerset is the closest town for dining but there are other little gems to dine at.
Ohiopyle, Falling Waters and the Flight 93 memorial are within a decent driving time. If you go to the memorial make sure you stay for a rangers speech, very educational.
If you don’t want to go anywhere then stay put and enjoy the peace and beauty that surrounds you. The swing overlooking the scenic view is awe inspiring. If you want to toast a marshmallow over a nice fire that can happen too. Or sit inside and enjoy the fire place. There are nice TVs but we didn’t even turn them on. Since it is fall we couldn’t enjoy the pool but that looked wonderful too.
There are a set of stairs that you have to go up and down to get into the apartment. The entrance is very nice thanks to the planters filled with beautiful flowers and the lights were all on motion sensors so our path was well lit no matter what time of day it was.
I truly can’t sum up in words how great this experience was, you just have to go yourself.
Our 9yr old gives it a 5 star review partially due to his little bedroom being behind the barn doors.

It’s in the basement of the hosts home so during thunderstorms I didn’t hear a thing. Know that this also has the opportunity to attract some bugs (I had some cricket company which doesn’t bother me), and can be humid but the host is on top of that with a dehumidifier. I did have to empty the bucket twice so just know that if you’re not familiar.
There is everything you need which is a welcome change (MANY places do not provide all the essentials). Shampoo and conditioner, dish soap, a Keurig, tea pot, and even laundry detergent (I had brought my own just in case).
As an animal lover this place was a gem 💎 I was greeted by a chicken, got to observe the beautiful bison, and met their beautiful cat. You are surrounded by beautiful countryside all around and the sunsets are spectacular.
